result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison N Peot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Allison N Peot in court, in custody (OTP'd from Jefferson County Jail), with attorney Matthew Huppertz.    

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
200 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to: Count 6
Court will allow to be served through Jefferson County.
  

RESTITUTION:  $304 (to be paid to the Victim C.B. listed in the criminal complaint to be paid by November 1, 2015, if not paid can be converted to a civil judgment).

Costs: $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid Forthwith - In Lieu of Payment - Defendant to Serve an additional 8 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time - Consecutive.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  




Count 6:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to:  Count 1.
Court will allow to be served through Jefferson County. 

Costs:  $243
To be paid Forthwith - In Lieu of Payment - Defendant to Serve an additional 2 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time - Consecutive.



Defendant to be returned to Jefferson County Jail - FORTHWITH.
from Jefferson County Jail.
